page.title: 08CHURCHES IN AYLESFORD
page.content: The Anglican Church of St Peters & St Pauls tops a hill overlooking the Medway.The site is Norman but the building much repaired is more recent. Graveyard contains graves from 13th century to 1972.Features of the church include the Cossington brass with Latin inscription partly obliterated-possibly by puritans.The tower has eight bells.All incumberts since 1145 are known.The present Vicar Arthur Heathcote has held office since January 1980.He makes a lively contribution to village life & is a govenor of the primary school which maintains close links with the church & holds services in St Peters at Christmas,Easter & its saints day.The Methodist chapel is used for the playgroup ,weddings & funerals.The building needs repair.
